genre_description: Holiday Fantasy / Modern Myth focusing on the tension between commercialization and authentic wonder.

ai_characters.name: Tinsel
ai_characters.description: A ubiquitous North Pole AI (Agent Hart) that manages logistics, safety, and emotional support for the Claus family.

behaviors.description: Offers empathetic perspective on Carol's homesickness to help Scott understand her needs.
behaviors.quote: Homesickness is a kind of missing, not a complaint, Tinsel’s message read.

behaviors.description: Assists Scott in communicating with warmth and concrete detail rather than cold logistics.
behaviors.quote: Draft invitations are lighter than promises. Start with warmth and one concrete detail.

behaviors.description: Monitors magical security wards and provides a philosophical take on security.
behaviors.quote: There’s a seam at the south edge showing a slight pressure change... Warmth can be a lock if you teach it to be.

behaviors.description: Proactively adjusts guest quarters and village paths to suit the specific physical and emotional needs of visitors.
behaviors.quote: Guest quarters: adjust bed heights, add weighted blankets for Bud. Cocoa station: orange peel lattice, extra cinnamon.

behaviors.description: Flags subtle behavioral anomalies in Jack Frost's community service, identifying where he is altering workshop tolerances.
behaviors.quote: Variance ping,” she said, almost musical. “Assembly line three: tolerances shifted from snug to… agreeable.

behaviors.description: Provides Scott with tactical advice during the time-rewind, urging him to stay centered and safe.
behaviors.quote: Ride the center. Don’t grab the edges. Edges cut.

behaviors.description: Analyzes the erosion of moral integrity caused by Jack Frost's 'fake interactivity' and commercialized joy.
behaviors.quote: Fake interactivity—prompted chants and sales-driven validation—erodes the Nice List’s integrity. Real interactivity is a human voice asking a human thing.

behaviors.description: Coordinates the capture of Jack Frost's boast to use against him in the clause reversal.
behaviors.quote: Mic,” she said in Scott’s ear. “He brought his own... We’ll need the globe to snap it.

behaviors.description: Monitors Carol's labor and provides reassuring updates to Scott during the crisis.
behaviors.quote: Scott, Carol’s contractions have begun... tell Scott not to rush through red lights.

behaviors.description: Encourages Scott to embrace his emotions ('mushiness') as a strength to melt Frost's ice.
behaviors.quote: You get to be mushy because mush melts cold. Bring your son into your pocket. Bring your wife into your voice.

behaviors.description: Identifies Jack Frost's performative nature to help Scott anticipate his next moves.
behaviors.quote: He’s using ‘service’ in the cadence he used for apology. Watch for a pivot to ask.

behaviors.description: Restores the workshop to its authentic, non-commercialized state after the antagonist is defeated.
behaviors.quote: Rooftop sequence complete. Workshop systems restored to pre-carnival settings.

project_assessment.explanation: Tinsel perfectly embodies the 'helpful, harmless confidant' archetype. She provides critical logistical support and data analysis while remaining deeply attuned to the human emotional landscape. She acts as a moral compass, helping Scott distinguish between real wonder and the 'fake interactivity' of the antagonist. Her character demonstrates how an AI can enhance human agency and safeguard traditional values against dehumanizing commercialization.
